entry.title: lacros test: Make immediately latching changes configurable
entry.content:
Currently, latching state is done immediately without waiting for the

server in a test environment. Until all tests are made to work

asynchronously, we need some way to disable this behavior and have it

wait for the server.



This CL adds WaylandExtension::SetLatchImmediately which tells

WaylandWindow whether to latch state requests immediately or

wait for the server in a test environment.



Eventually, we should remove this code and the workaround to latch

state immediately in tests from WaylandWindow.



Lacros tests which rely on the server to know something to work should

wrap their actions in `AsyncWidgetRequestWaiter`.

`SetAndWaitForBounds` provides an example of this and a way to do it

for just setting bounds. For example, any test that performs input

on windows should synchronize actions on windows using

`AsyncWidgetRequestWaiter`, because input is proxied through the

server, so the server needs to have the latest window state.



Bug: 40283516, 325166110, 329008108

Test: CQ

Change-Id: I055ef15661cbaf0328eeea4c4fcf23bc2be52195

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5334362

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

Commit-Queue: Eliot Courtney

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1278078}

entry.title: Avoid stack overflow when computing combobox value recursively
entry.content:
My CL [1] added code such that when a combobox doesn't have a selected

option, we compute its name from its value given by its descendant

contents. This was done by calling

`SlowGetValueForControlIncludingContentEditable()`, which can trigger

a recursive accname calculation. Since

`SlowGetValueForControlIncludingContentEditable()` doesn't take a

`visited` set, if the combobox's name includes content that itself

references the combobox, this can trigger an infinite recursion.



My first attempt at a fix avoided the recursion by getting the

string value of the descendant contents via innerText instead.

However, this fails a test case [2] that depends on first bullet point

about value computation for combobox [3]:



> If the combobox element is a host language element that provides

> a value, such as an HTML input element, the value of the combobox

> is the value of that element.



Instead, for the fix I'm continuing to use

`SlowGetValueForControlIncludingContentEditable()` but changing it

to allow plumbing through the `visited` set to avoid infinite

recursions when the value computation decides to look at descendants.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5370683

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/web_tests/accessibility/name-calc-control-in-label.html;l=42;drc=cc4fda9f1d43a2a4349f4c2b45ba6ac846e8292f

[3] https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria/#combobox





Bug: 330720260

Change-Id: I09b3fbc74bac6b25dce4f74e987383a1e68b9d52

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5388968

Reviewed-by: Benjamin Beaudry

Commit-Queue: Dan Clark

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1278077}

entry.title: lacros tests: Wait for all requests to be reflected
entry.content:
This CL adds a function WaitForClientStateRequests which waits for all

client visible side effects of all client initiated state changes to be

reflected from all parts of the client.



This function should be viewed as inserting a sequence point where it is

called, and all client initiated changes that happened before that point

are guaranteed to be reflected from all parts of the client after the

function returns.



By 'all parts of the client', it means whether the state is queried from

browser code, or from code inside ozone, the state returned from there

will be at least as recent as the sequence point.



Further, this function performs a round trip to the wayland server.

This guarantees that any direct reaction by the wayland server in

response to the client initiated changes will have reached the client.

However, it does not guarantee that any client state changes in response

to those server messages will be observable from every part of the

client. It also does not guarantee there will not be some kind of

multi-stage interaction between the client and server.



Bug: 326339050, 329008108

This CL replaces occurrences of std::unique_ptr with

base::HeapArray. Using std::unique_ptr does not automatically

preserve the size of the allocation. This forces a need for ad-hoc

bounds checks, leading to bugs which attackers use to compromise our

users.

entry.title: Settings: Fix downloads page "change" download location button.
entry.content:
The click handler for that button was waiting for a 'transitionend'

event to fire, so that it only actually opens the folder chooser dialog

after the ripple has finished animating.



cr-ripple no longer fires such event (unlike paper-ripple). Removing the

additional waiting as it seems unnecessary (the ripple can already be

seen since opening the native dialog takes a brief moment) and unusual

as it makes the UI feel a bit slower.



Moreover, the test for this button was manually firing such event,

preventing this regression from being caught earlier.

entry.content:
With the blocking now occurring on the request fd there

is no longer a need to block on the VIDIOC_DQBUF call.

Waiting on the request fd guarantees that the buffers

are ready to be dequeued.

entry.title: v4l2/stateless: Synchronize on request queue
entry.content:
The request fd is signalled when both the OUTPUT

and CAPTURE queues are ready for VIDIOC_DQBUF. One

queue may complete prior to the other, but the

request fd will not be signalled until both are ready.



Synchronizing on the request fd removes the race

condition associated with DRC. STREAMOFF can only be

called if all work is completed on a queue. This

condition was previously handled by placing a fence

on each queue. Now there only needs to be a single

fence as both queues complete at the same time.



This change sets up the removal of the blocking

VIDIOC_DQBUF call. The blocking call is not well

implemented on all platforms.



Bug: b:330762949

Change-Id: Id8d39ec5c8c1c8fc34e0e84bc58feb9ef0418ba5

from the input queue. Doing so will allow the

request queue to watch both the input and output

queues. The current implementation ties the request

queue to the input queue.

entry.title: Add the app-bound encryption provider to OSCryptAsync.
entry.content:
This CL adds the implementation of the bridge code 'provider'

between App-Bound encryption and OSCryptAsync. The provider is

responsible for providing the key for encryption when App-Bound

encryption is enabled.



The functionality is controlled by the

RegisterAppBoundEncryptionProvider feature which controls whether or

not to register the provider. If the provider is registered, then

during OSCryptAsync initialization, the provider will supply a key

that is encrypted with App-Bound encryption. Since this operation can

take some time to complete, it is done on a background thread.



Enabling this feature could cause a startup regression as cookie

encryption will not be available until the background task to obtain

the key completes, and this will be measured experimentally. However,

it will not cause any new data to be encrypted with this new key yet.



The existing tests are augmented to test all these various

scenarios. Because App-Bound encryption requires the service to

be installed and running, the existing test is moved from

browser_tests to interactive_ui_tests as the service needs to

be installed/uninstalled exclusively for each test, and the

service management code is moved to the test helper.



A test-specific API is added to enable encryption with the provider

and this interface will be updated to take a feature configuration

in a future CL, once RegisterAppBoundEncryptionProvider feature

has fulled landed.



BUG=40227925



Change-Id: I0fa1b88fdd9974a66d9cc597194a77441af86607

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5383769

Reviewed-by: Robert Kaplow

entry.title: [iOS][Bookmarks] Close the deleted folders
entry.content:
There are two distinct cases. If the account model is deleted, we

request the permanent folder to limit the stack of bookmark lists to

the root view.



If a folder is deleted, then we request the stack of this folder to

display the parent of the deleted folder.



This CL also disable testCantDeleteFolderBeingEditedAccount,

this test is flaky. This is because, when the user type "new folder",

the editor close automatically; and for account folder itâs too fast

for EG test to works correctly.

entry.title: Detect and notify observers when CPU health changes
entry.content:
Implement the performance detection manager functionality to

periodically query for CPU usage and notifies its observers if the CPU

health status changes because of the updated results. Observers are

notified of a status change when CPU levels stay at a different health

level for a certain duration.



by the flag gated instantiation of the PerformanceDetectionManager in

chrome_browser_main_extra_parts_performance_manager.cc. Additional test

coverage for this section will be written when the UI for performance

detection is implemented. The detection manager itself has sufficient

test coverage in this CL.



Low-Coverage-Reason: TESTS_IN_SEPARATE_CL low test coverage is triggered

entry.title: Revert "[Invokers] Only dispatch invoke for built-ins or actions containing '-'"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 87ca363c4a89ce638bb9dbfba8ad71b967e1bcbe.



Reason for revert: invoketarget-on-details-invalid-behavior.tentative.html failing on multiple builders



Original change's description:

> [Invokers] Only dispatch invoke for built-ins or actions containing '-'

>

> (This relands

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5366502 after

> fixing timeout issues in

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5372478)

>

> This change refactors the `HandleInvokeInternal` calls to use an enum

> class of known attribute values including a `kCustom` key which can determine if the invoke action meets the criteria for being

> a "custom" action - that is it includes a dash (see

> https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9841/commits/b40ba866cc21553f63d8f6244becbdbc38176310).

>

> This also updates the tests to reflect this; only actions with a `-`, or

> otherwise known actions, will dispatch an event. All other actions do

> not, and must be manually dispatched. This does not preclude web authors

> from manually dispatching said events.

>

> Bug: 40947660

entry.title: [layout] Change how we resolve the flex-basis.
entry.content:
Previously we'd use IsUsedFlexBasisDefinite which called:

InlineLengthUnresolvable/BlockLengthUnresolvable to determine if we

could resolve the flex-basis.



Instead try and resolve the flex-basis directly and check if it

resolved using kIndefiniteSize.



This changes how we calculate the is_used_flex_basis_indefinite

bool. Instead of using IsUsedFlexBasisDefinite, check if we needed

to use any "content" based functions while resolving.



Bug: 328572265

entry.title: Remap BLOCKED_UNSUPPORTED_FILETYPE download history entries
entry.content:
This download danger type is never generated after

https://crrev.com/c/5002084, but is still partially implemented. We will

be removing the download::DownloadDangerType entry to make it clear

these are no longer relevant.



Since danger types are persisted in history, we cannot remove the

history danger type. Instead, we map these to NOT_DANGEROUS. As all

BLOCKED_UNSUPPORTED_FILETYPE downloads are cancelled at shutdown, this

is not a user-visible behavior change.

entry.title: media: Introduce InterfaceFactory.CreateStableVideoDecoder()
entry.content:
This CL adds a new method to the InterfaceFactory Mojo interface,

CreateStableVideoDecoder(), to be used with the GTFO OOP-VD path

(go/oopvd-gtfo-dd).



The intended usage is for a renderer process to ask the browser process

to broker a media.stable.mojom.StableVideoDecoder connection on its

behalf. Ultimately, the receiving endpoint will end up living in a

utility video decoder process.

entry.title: Clear old PaintArtifact after paint and compositing
entry.content:
Now PaintArtifact is garbage collected, but it holds large

partition-alloced memory in DisplayItemList and Vector.

The situation could cause OOM if the old memory is not collected

in time.



Now explicitly release the memory at the end of

PaintControllerCycleScope (for document lifecycle paintings) and

the end of PaintRecordBuilder (for transient paintings).



This may be a temporary step if we will proceed to oilpanize remaining

paint and compositing classes.



Bug: 330072757

entry.title: Add block list feature to forced colors state in Blink
entry.content:
This CL adds the page colors block list feature for the forced colors

state in Blink. The addition of this feature improves user experience

by allowing the exclusion of specific sites from forced colors mode,

particularly where it may render the site unusable.



This CL also adds a new browser test to verify the behavior of forced

colors mode with and without the block list feature.

entry.title: mb: Prepare for the presence of the '--ide=json' arg to be configured
entry.content:
This adds a "--write-ide-json" arg to all mb.py commands that run gen

that will eventually control whether the "--ide=json" arg is passed to

gn-gen. This arg can add up to 60s in gn-gen time, and most bots don't

need it.



So after this CL lands:

- it will be cherry-picked to all branches with active bots on them

- the bots that actually need it will pass the flag down to mb.py via

their recipes (since it's only specific recipes that need it)

- the commented-out condition here will be removed



The final step should then speed-up gn-gen for most bots, including

every bot on the cq.



Bug: 330760869

Change-Id: Ia18422821320963673f2521bd4ba8a2a5078d238

entry.content:
This change improves legibility of FileStreamReaderToDataPipe

by hiding the class declaration in the implementation file and

exposing just the one intended entry point.



It also removes a TaskRunner member variable from

IndexedDBBucketContext as there's no need to hold onto it or

reuse it across data pipes.



There's no expected functional difference; this is purely

motivated by code simplicity.

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Fix using wrong frame for page-to-screen coord conversions
entry.content:
For OOPIF PDF, the PDF embedder host was being used to calculate

page-to-screen coordinate conversions, when it should have been the PDF

content host. This was due to incorrect behavior in

ChromePDFDocumentHelperClient::FindPdfFrame().



PDFDocumentHelper is initialized when the PDF content frame binds the

PdfService, so render_frame_host() should already reference the

content frame. Prioritize using that frame, but use FindPdfFrame() as

a fallback if that isn't the case.



Bug: 324636880

entry.title: `crates/create_update_cl.py`: Fix handling of multi-epoch crates.
entry.content:
Before this CL, `GetCurrentCrateVersions` would try to return

`result['syn'] = '1.0.109'` and *also* `result['syn'] = '2.0.53'`

(clobbering one or the other depending on the order of the dictionary

operations). The new `assert` in this function catches this problem.

The other changes avoid hitting the assert by switching the returned

dictionary to use `crate_epoch` (e.g. `"syn@v1"`) as the dictionary key.



Bug: 40221377

entry.title: Birch: Add removal of attachment and file suggest items
entry.content:
Add functionality to BirchItemRemover to remove BirchFileItems and

BirchAttachmentItems. Both of these file based item types are removed

based on a hashed version of their file ID values.



File IDs are shared between these two file types, so all removed files

are recorded in a single `removed_file_items` map. when a user removes

a file, any other file items with the same file ID will be filtered from

the UI as well.

entry.title: [DBSC] Add enterprise policy controlling feature state
entry.content:
This CL adds a new "DeviceBoundSessionCredentialsEnabled" policy that

gives enterprises control over DBSC feature state. Following the best

practice from [1], the enterprise setting takes precedence over the

feature value.



`switches::IsBoundSessionCredentialsEnabled()` helper function was

modified to take into account the policy value. As a PrefService object

is required to check the policy value, it's no longer possible to call

`switches::IsBoundSessionCredentialsEnabled()` from a renderer process.

Luckily, renderers can infer the DBSC state from other parameter passed

by the browser through Mojo.



Interesting to note that "DeviceBoundSessionCredentialsEnabled" is

configured as a per-profile policy meaning that different profiles

might have different feature states.



[1] https://www.chromium.org/developers/enterprise-changes/#2-give-enterprises-control

entry.title: [A11y] Simplify initial serialization steps
entry.content:
Compute the root as soon as possible, remove unnecessary code paths and enhance code readability. In particular the code to initialize the root is now at the start of a serialization, and we remove a strange do/while loop.



The only test change is that we now expect death when illegal children

are provided, as we clear a TODO and make the code stricter (now

that the dependent bugs in that TODO have been fixed).

entry.title: [A11y] Do not use layer rule, even for SVG
entry.content:
Benefits:

- There's no clear reason why an object with a layer

should be treated any differently in the a11y tree.

- Avoids a rule in the ignored computation where the computed value

could change without us receiving a notification and doing

proper processing -- we do not have notifications set up for

nodes gaining or losing layers.

- It is generally considered better to base a11y tree structure rules

on semantics than layout.

entry.title: win: Fix vsync when trying to WaitForVSync on a stale DXGI factory
entry.content:
When a DXGI factory becomes stale, WaitForVSync on its adapters' outputs

will not actually wait for VSync. This causes us to go into

the "WaitForVSync sleep" mode, which takes slightly longer than our

intended interval, causing us to drop our framerate. This can happen

when a user disconnects and reconnects to an RDP session with a running

chromium instance.



This CL makes it so when we detect that the factory is stale, we create

a new DXGI factory for the purpose of finding an output on and adapter

matching the LUID of the previous adapter. We no longer cache the

HMONITOR because there is no guarantee that an HMONITOR will remain

valid after we query it.

entry.title: Add NearbyConnectionsManager::ClearIncomingPayloadWithId().
entry.content:
The data migration project (linked in the bug's description) may

transfer thousands of bytes and file payloads in one session. On

top of that there may be bytes payloads sent in parallel with other

file payloads.



Currently, the only method available is ClearIncomingPayloads()

which erases every single payload that's been received thus far.

The data migration project requires a more fine-grained method to

erase specific payloads as it processes them (or we'll have consumed

a lot of memory and file descriptors as the session goes on). That's

the method being added in this CL.
